suggestions: Specify exact dates for public meetings to ensure clarity and accountability.
Include a provision for handling potential amendments or objections raised during public discussions.
Clarify the voting process, including how ties will be handled or what constitutes a quorum.
Detail the criteria for what a 'majority vote' entails, particularly in the context of absent council members.

issues: Specific dates for public meetings and voting need to be established.
Consideration of potential objections or amendments to the ordinance should be addressed.
input.original_headline: Will the city council vote to approve the downtown redevelopment ordinance by november 30?

sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: The purpose of this contract is to establish a clear framework for the city council's approval process regarding the downtown redevelopment ordinance, ensuring transparency and community involvement in decision-making.

sections.title: Scope
sections.content: This contract covers the public meetings scheduled to discuss the downtown redevelopment ordinance. Specific dates for these meetings will be established and communicated to the public in advance to ensure accountability. Additionally, the contract includes provisions for addressing any amendments or objections raised during these discussions, allowing for community feedback and participation.

sections.title: Terms
sections.content: The voting process for the approval of the downtown redevelopment ordinance will be clearly defined. A quorum will be established as [insert specific number] of council members present. In the event of a tie, the ordinance will be considered rejected. A majority vote will be defined as more than half of the votes cast by present council members, excluding any absent members. The criteria for determining the majority will be explicitly outlined to ensure fairness in the voting process.
